ygData.subject: Re: Warriors vs Hybrids
ygData.msgSnippet: I would like to start this off by saying that this is not against you at all. I am just trying to clerify all this out. If you read this full email before
ygData.messageBody:
I would like to start this off by saying that this is not against you at
all. I am just trying to clerify all this out. If you read this full email
before starting to piss and flame on it then maybe you will become more
enlightened as to balance. Yes i agree warriors do need a LITTLE (read
that) tweaking but not by much just to improve them a little bit.
I have sniped out the parts where i will explain so please go through the
email and read it in full.. (sorry it is kind of long) but this I hope
will give everyone idea's and agree along with this.. The balance is VERY
well done.. just a full little tweaks and walla everyone is happy.

On Fri, 11 Jun 1999 sigurd@... wrote:

> From: sigurd@...
>
> I have enjoyed this discussion so far. I don't have much of an issue with
> warriors vs wizards. They traded hps, ac, and melee ability for high damage
> dealing spells. However it appears I agree with many of you that is is the
> hybrids that appear to have a distinct advantage over us. The hybrid that has
> the most advantage appears to be the ranger. For various reasons I find I am
> unable to group with the people I normally play with. I am unable to solo many
> mobs even in the blue and green range, and really I have more fun in groups. I
> have been traveling to many zones shouting that I am looking for a group, but to
> no avail. It appears to me that many groups are prefering rangers over warriors,
> and after I read the post on EQ'Lizer I began to realize why.
>
> Advantages Warriors get over Rangers:
>
> - We get Dual Wield and Double Attack at 2 levels lower than Rangers, but after
> a few levels they are back on par with us in the damage dealing department. So
> as Wayne Sheppard wrote, "the Warrior has no skill advantage over the hybrids."

Your wrong on this 2 levels no.. Yes rangers get duel weild and double
attack but duel weild comes at level 17 and Double Attack Comes at level
20. I really never have had a problem with a ranger having this ability
let them have it more fun in the game. Not like rangers are master
casters.

>
> -Warriors get more hit points. This only appears to be true for the larger races
> and rangers easily overcome this by being able to heal themselves, thus actually
> taking more pressure off of the cleric to heal them.

Hrm well I have no idea what parties everyone travels with but the parties
i am with people buff me up also. So in turn yes i STILL do end up with
more Hit points
>
> -Berserker Frenzy. As it has been stated before, I see no real advantage to
> getting a strength boost and a dex penalty when I am close to dying. I would
> rather not get hit more often when I am low on hp. It makes us die that much
> quicker.

This i can agree with most of the time when you hit frenzy mode you are
basically dead anyways

>
> Advantages Rangers have over Warriors:
>
> -Rangers get foraging. Not much of advantage in combat, but they can help keep
> the party supplied with food without any mana cost. They can also carry more
> loot since they don't have to carry lots of food. They just forage on demand.
<SNIP>

If you want foraging become a wood elf warrior. ALL wood elfs i belive
have the foraging skill I know for fact wood elf warriors have forage.

>
> -Rangers get Hiding and Sneak. This allows the rangers to live longer because
> they can avoid more of the deadlier Mobs that would target a warrior.
<SNIP>

Again wood elf warriors have this also

>
> -Rangers get the very useful skill of Tracking. This is a great advantage to
> groups because the rangers make the best fetches. They party can heal up and
> rest adn stay organized while the rangers are out searching for prey. This means
> the party spends less down time and can fight more.
<SNIP>
Rangers should have tracking they are a ranger. And yes they can heal up
but their healing isnt the best in the game it only cuts downtime by a
bit.

>
> -Rangers cast spells. They not only get some minor healing spells, but also are
> able to do root spells, direct damage spells, so they can kick, attack, and cast
> spells doing more damage than us. They also get spells that are useful to the
> entire party like camoflage and SOW allowing the party to travel more safely.
<SNIP>

Ok boy i seem like a flamer but again. If you want spells play a ranger
warriors should not have spells. and as ranger spell damage. Look at the
spells
level 9 - Flame lick (uhm more like lame lick) it does a whole WOPPING 5
points of damage. Boy that sure deals a lot

Level 15 - Lighting. At level 15 it is a slower spell to cast it does do
25 points of damage MAX. And it burns through mana quickly

And we do get spells beyond this. As for camoflage well yes rangers should
be able to cast this spell seeing they are one of the best at knowing the
lands

>
>
> Changes:
>
> - I like the idea of eliminating the skill cap of 200 and giving us a bonus in
> combat related skills. I think it was 5*lvl +10 instead of 5*lvl +5. Or they
> could eliminate the bonus the hybrids get, so they only get 5*lvl. This would
> allow a warrior of equal level to show a slight advantage over our hybrid
> brothers.
I dont think the cap should be eliminated but should be raised much of
that like the monk.. maybe the cap topping off at 240 or something where
in the end they will deal more damage but not as much as a pure caster.

>
> - To make it more apparent that warriors excell at combat I think rangers should
> not get Double Attack. After all Verant stated that they hybrids gave up
> something to get those spells and extra abilities. I don't see a problem with
> Dual Wield because many of us grew up with D&D's image of rangers wielding two
> swords. If paladins appear to be struggling at later levels they might get
> Double Attack to allow them to keep up with the rangers.

I do not agree with this at all. Let rangers have double attack sure it is
seems unfair but Rangers do not have the all might god spell casting
ability of a pure spell caster. Look at rangers for a second and what
levels they get spells at. This is what gets annoying to me when people do
this. Rangers have druid type damage spells. Rangers get the spells way
later when mob's end up being tougher to begin with. You people keep
blowing this spell stuff WAY out of the water.

> -It's been stated that at higher levels that the casters are doing so much
> damage that we cannot Taunt the Mobs off of them. So I think that Taunt should
> be boosted at higher levels causing the Mobs to pay more attention to us and do
> our job of keeping thier attention while the caster burn them.

That is the casters fault.. think about it for a second it seems like you
keep jumping to conclusions. You have 500 hit points. Someone casts a
spell on you and hits you for 100 points of damage. And another thing is
hitting you for 40 points a round max. The person hitting you for 40
points says some naughty words at you. Who would you kill first? No
question I would kill the thing that is hitting me harder first. ITS
CALLED ARTIFICAL INTELLIGENCE. Taunt does work i have used it successfully
many of times. The part it seems to be going wrong is your dumb wizard
keeps casting 1 spell right after another. And i think that would piss me
off a little bit more then someone saying a few bad words about my mother.

>
> -I also really like the critical hit skill. It should be innate like Parry and
> Dodge. It would help us more of an asset to a party instead of a spell casting
> warrior that can track like the rangers are now. They just seem to have many of
> the same advantages we have and sacrificed nothing to get thier spells and
> tracking and other abilites.
Now this is something that SHOULD be done... maybe not a critical hit. How
about this just think about it before you start flaming

Warriors are the masters of fighting melee combat. They SHOULD know their
enemy and SHOULD know vital points of striking are. How about a random
Vital Hit where it would come out of the blue sort of like the mob made a
mistake in an attempted hit at you but you dodge or miss because your read
that attack and you used this to your KEEN ability and hit them in this
open vital spot maybe for 1.5 to 2 times the normal damage. Even better..
it doesnt start at level 1 or lvl 20. Maybe around level 25 or so you
start to become a more knowledgable warrior being through the years and
many fights. You become more masterable at fighting and you train in this
skill with your leader and the better you raise in the skill the more
often this vital hit will appear. The good points about this are it will
not WACK the balance out of the game. Warriors WILL indeed be the masters
of fighting with this tactic. Warriors would be wanted WAY more by groups
because of this nice little ability. I think everyone would not mind it
due to the fact that it is not a HUGE ability but it is something that
will distinguish your warrior from ANY other class. Now all of you are
probably saying ONLY 1.5 to 2X DAMAGE?!!?! LAME. well if you say this then
you most likly arent thinking so let me explain why only that much.

I carry a nice 2 handed sword. (shows nice weapon)
I hit for a maximum of 25 dmg lets say.

1.5X that would be about 43 dmg in 1 swing? wow i like that

2X dmg that would be 50 DMG in 1 swing with only a 2h sword. NICE damage
but not WAY out of control.

The damage could vary on armor the mob is wearing seeing as yes that would
soak up some damage.

I would love to hear anyones flames or cheers for this idea.


KLAEN
